sen.j: 頼豪（らいごう、長保4年（1002年） - 応徳元年（1084年））は、平安時代中期の天台宗の日本の僧。
sen.e: Raigo (1002-1084) was a Japanese monk of Tendai sect in the mid Heian period.

sen.j: 父は伊賀国守藤原有家。
sen.e: His father was FUJIWARA no Ariie, the director of Iga Province.

sen.j: 園城寺（三井寺）の心誉に師事し、円行から法を受け、実相院に住した。
sen.e: He studied under Shinyo of Onjo-ji Temple (Mii-dera Temple) and learned "Ho" (dharma, which has various meanings such as order, rule, law, custom) from Engyo, and he lived in Jisso-in Temple.

sen.j: 修法の効験で知られ、1074年（承保元年）白河天皇の皇子誕生を祈願し、敦文親王が誕生したことから、園城寺の戒壇創設を天皇に請うたが、延暦寺の反対により実現しなかった。
sen.e: Gaining fame for the efficacy of his incantation and prayer, he prayed for the birth of an Imperial prince to Emperor Shirakawa in 1074, which brought the birth of Imperial Prince Atsufumi to the emperor, therefore he requested the emperor to give him a reward with the establishment of the kaidan (platform for teaching the precepts to monks and nuns) in Onjo-ji Temple, but his request was dismissed due to the opposition from Enryaku-ji Temple.

sen.j: その後怨念を抱いて断食して命を絶ち、怨霊となって鉄鼠に化して延暦寺の経典を食い破り、敦文親王は四歳で頼豪の祟りによって死んだとされる。
sen.e: With bearing a grudge, he killed himself by fasting to be a rancorous ghost taking the shape of an iron rat (a huge rat as large as a bull with a stone body and iron teeth), and bit and torn the Buddhist scriptures belonging to Enryaku-ji Temple, as well as cursed 4-year-old Imperial Prince Atsufumi to death, it was widely believed.

Bearing a grudge because of this, he killed himself by fasting to death, and it was widely believed that he became a rancorous ghost taking the shape of an iron rat (a huge rat as large as a bull with a stone body and iron teeth), and bit and tore the Buddhist scriptures belonging to Enryaku-ji Temple, as well as causing the death of the 4-year-old Imperial Prince Atsufumi.
